# tiedr

tiedr is not tidyr.

## Usages

### `bundle()` and `unbundle()`

`bundle()` bundles columns into a data.frame column, and `unbundle()` unbundles it.

```{r}
library(tiedr)

iris <- tibble::as_tibble(iris)

# bundle() takes unnamed arguments
iris %>% 
  bundle(-Species)

# bundle() also takes named arguments
d <- iris %>% 
  bundle(Sepal = starts_with("Sepal"),
         Petal = starts_with("Petal"))

# bundled columns can be bundled
d %>%
  bundle(-Species)

# unbundle()
unbundle(d, Sepal, Petal)
```
